newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Modelo upgraded to long-term buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Modelo upgraded to long-term buy.

text.p: -- Interacciones brokerage said it upgraded Mexican brewer Grupo Modelo to long-term buy from hold.

- Analyst Isabel Rueda said that in the first quarter of 1997, Modelo will start operations on the first phase of its eighth plant, located in Zacatecas, and will have an installed capacity of 15 million hectolitres and will increase by 50 percent the company's total installed capacity.
- The multiples of the company have been high, given that Modelo historically has been financially solid and has a high potential for growth.

- From 1998, the benefits of the new plant will start to be registered. Given that the plant has been financed in-house, which has limited cash flows, the investments will be lower from then on, "which is why we have decided to increase our recommendation" on Modelo, Interacciones said.
